name: setaria-viridis
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
fruit-description: Oval, tapered and flattened seeds fall from the spikelet
flower-description: Spike-like panicle that is 1-4 inches long, erect and often nods as it reaches the tip. 2-6 spikelets (flower clusters) are densely packed along the panicle. At the base of each are 1-3 bristles that are green or purple
leaf-description: Light green leaves are 2-12 inches long and about .5 to 1 inch wide with fine but distinctive veins and a drooping form. They are scabrous above, usually glabrous below and sheaths are sometimes purplish at the base with a few hairs.
stem-description: Stems are green, smooth, erect to ascending the lower part is often prostrate, then grows upward.
